item.title: 日本激进分子的影响力在股东否决大洋集团首席执行官一事中显露无遗
item.description: 上周末，股东们否决了佐藤英二连任大洋控股公司首席执行官，这是一个罕见的事件，凸显了激进分子在日本股票市场日益增长的影响力。【原文：Shareholders’ rejection of another term for Eiji Sato as Taiyo Holdings Co. chief executive officer over the weekend was a rare event highlighting the growing clout of activists in Japan’s stock market.】

item.title: 瑞银下调泰国股市评级至 "中性"，原因是政治忧虑加重
item.description: 瑞银集团策略师将泰国股票评级从 "增持 "下调至 "中性"，理由是近期的政治不确定性可能会影响政策方向和投资者情绪。【原文：UBS Group AG strategists downgraded Thai stocks to neutral from overweight, citing recent political uncertainty which could impact policy direction and investor sentiment.】

item.title: 据称蒙太奇将为 10 亿美元的香港上市聘请银行
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，中国芯片设计公司澜起科技已为其香港上市计划聘请了银行，该上市计划可能融资约 10 亿美元。【原文：Chinese chip designer Montage Technology Co. has hired banks for its planned Hong Kong listing that could raise about $1 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 刚果延长禁令后中国钴价和库存飙升
item.description: 刚果民主共和国将出口禁令延长至 9 月，限制了合金和电池所用原材料的供应，此后中国的钴价和库存飙升。【原文：Cobalt prices and stocks surged in China after the Democratic Republic of Congo extended its export ban to September, constricting supplies of the raw material used in alloys and batteries.】

item.title: 中国的降雨正值煤炭和大坝行业的关键时刻
item.description: 中国西南部和中部地区连绵不断的暴雨正在灌满为中国巨大水坝提供水源的河流和水库，这对与水力发电竞争的煤炭市场构成了另一个威胁。【原文：The heavy rains rolling though southwestern and central China are filling up the rivers and reservoirs that feed the country’s mighty dams, posing another threat to the coal market that competes with hydropower in electricity generation.】

item.title: 高盛：中东局势下石油和天然气价格有望上涨
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. flagged the possibility of higher oil and gas prices after the US struck Iran, even as the bank’s base-case outlook hinges on major disruptions to supplies from the region.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织总裁格奥尔基耶娃警告美国打击伊朗将带来更大风险
item.description: 国际货币基金组织总裁克里斯塔琳娜-格奥尔基耶娃（Kristalina Georgieva）警告说，随着全球不确定性的升级，美国对伊朗的打击可能会在能源渠道之外产生更广泛的影响。【原文：International Monetary Fund Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva warned that the US strikes on Iran could potentially have broader impacts beyond energy channels, as global uncertainty escalates.】

item.title: 卢比跌至关键水平附近考验印度央行对波动的容忍度
item.description: 印度卢比对美元的跌势正将其推向一个临界点，从而引发了在全球紧张局势加剧之际印度央行可能会出手稳定货币的预期。【原文：The Indian rupee’s decline against the dollar is pushing it closer to a critical threshold, raising expectations that the nation’s central bank may step in to stabilize the currency as global tensions mount.】

item.title: 特斯拉低调推出期待已久的机器人出租车服务
item.description: 特斯拉公司周日向少数乘客推出了其承诺已久的无人驾驶出租车服务，这是埃隆马斯克（Elon Musk）认为具有变革意义的新业务线的一次小规模亮相。【原文：Tesla Inc. rolled out its long-promised driverless taxi service to a handful of riders Sunday, a modest debut for what Elon Musk sees as a transformative new business line.】

item.title: 日本股东大会用免费赠品吸引投资者
item.description: 越来越多的日本公司在年度股东大会上赠送礼品，这种做法可能会增加忠实散户投资者的数量，因为来自激进投资者的压力越来越大。【原文：More Japanese companies are giving gifts at annual general meetings in a practice that could increase the ranks of loyal retail investors as pressure from activist investors grows.】

item.title: 美国打击伊朗后，石油市场再添不确定性
item.description: 美国上周末对伊朗的打击增加了全球石油供应的风险，而迄今为止，全球石油供应并未受到中东多年来一些最极端军事行动的影响。【原文：US strikes on Iran over the weekend have added to risks for global oil supply, which has so far been unaffected by some of the most extreme military actions in the Middle East in years.】

item.title: 韩国早期贸易数据在关税截止日期前反弹
item.description: 韩国的早期贸易数据出现反弹，这表明首尔在 7 月初全面关税上调之前，正努力推进与华盛顿的谈判。【原文：South Korea’s early trade data rebounded, offering signs of resilience as Seoul works to advance talks with Washington before across-the-board tariffs are set to rise in early July.】

item.title: 伊朗遭袭后石油大涨，美国期货下跌：市场综述
item.description: 美国上周末对伊朗核基地发动打击后，市场出现震荡，局势急剧升级，导致油价飙升，美元在早盘交易中走高。【原文：Markets jolted after the US launched strikes on Iran’s nuclear sites over the weekend, a sharp escalation that sent oil prices surging and the dollar higher in early trading.】

item.title: 美国加入攻击伊朗行列刺激黄金上涨
item.description: 在美国加入以色列对伊朗的攻击后，黄金上涨，这增加了爆发更广泛地区战争的风险，可能会推高能源价格。【原文：Gold rose after the US joined the Israeli assault on Iran , raising the risks of a wider regional war that could push up energy prices.】

item.title: 特朗普攻击伊朗加剧供应风险，石油价格飙升
item.description: 在美国袭击伊朗三个主要核基地并威胁发动进一步袭击后，石油价格飙升，加剧了中东危机，激起了人们对该地区能源供应可能中断的担忧。【原文：Oil surged after the US struck Iran’s three main nuclear sites and threatened further attacks, exacerbating a crisis in the Middle East and stoking concerns that energy supplies from the region could be disrupted.】

item.title: 三花制药斥资 12 亿美元上市后将首次在香港交易
item.description: 浙江三花智能控制股份有限公司（Zhejiang Sanhua Intelligent Controls Co.【原文：Zhejiang Sanhua Intelligent Controls Co., the Chinese maker of fridge parts that’s working on becoming a cutting-edge robotics company, will begin trading in Hong Kong on Monday after its HK$9.3 billion ($1.2 billion) debut stock offering.】

item.title: 因商标诉讼，乔尼-艾维的交易被从 OpenAI 网站删除
item.description: 由于商标争议，苹果公司前设计师乔尼-艾维（Jony Ive）与 OpenAI 公司之间的合作大片的相关营销材料和视频被从网上删除。【原文：Marketing materials and video related to a blockbuster partnership between former Apple Inc. designer Jony Ive and OpenAI Inc. were removed from the web due to a trademark dispute.】

item.title: 美军打击后两艘超级油轮在霍尔木兹海峡掉头
item.description: 在美国空袭伊朗之后，两艘可装载约 200 万桶原油的超级油轮在霍尔木兹海峡掉头，这增加了美国采取应对措施的风险，将使该地区的商业航运陷入困境。【原文：Two supertankers both capable of hauling about 2 million barrels of crude U-turned in the Strait of Hormuz after US airstrikes on Iran raised the risk of a response that will ensnare commercial shipping in the region.】

item.title: 日本在出售风险债券前大幅削减长期债券发行量
item.description: 日本超长期债券发行量的削减幅度大于预期，有可能在本周拍卖前缓解收益率的一些上升压力，而本周拍卖有可能重燃债市动荡。【原文：Japan’s larger-than-expected cut to super-long bond issuance has potential to ease some upward pressure on yields just before an auction this week that risks reigniting turmoil in the debt market.】

item.title: 苹果与媒体大亨彼得-切宁达成电影交易
item.description:
《福特诉法拉利》和《重返行动》 的制片人从 Netflix 转投苹果

。【原文：

The producer of Ford v. Ferrari and Back in Action moves from Netflix to Apple

】

item.title: 美联储戴利称央行沟通应灵活多样
item.description: 旧金山联邦储备银行行长玛丽-戴利（Mary Daly）表示，鉴于使用强有力的前瞻性指导有时 "需要付出代价"，央行行长们需要在不确定时期灵活沟通。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco President Mary Daly said central bankers need to communicate with flexibility at times of uncertainty, given that using strong forward guidance sometimes “comes with a price.”】

item.title: 美国最大电网发布周一高温能源紧急警报
item.description: 为大西洋中部至中西部地区约 20% 的美国人提供服务的 PJM Interconnection 宣布发出能源紧急警报，预计在酷热天气下电力需求将攀升至 14—year 新高。【原文：PJM Interconnection, which serves about 20% of Americans in the mid-Atlantic to the Midwest, declared an energy emergency alert with power demand expected to climb to a 14—year high amid intense heat.】

item.title: 参议院可保留特朗普税收法案中对各州人工智能规则的禁令
item.description: 共和党阻止美国各州执行新人工智能法规的努力将暂时保留在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统的大规模税收和支出方案中，这标志着科技公司赢得了一场胜利，他们推动在全国范围内拖延和推翻数十项人工智能安全法律。【原文：A Republican effort to block US states from enforcing new artificial intelligence regulations will remain in President Donald Trump’s massive tax and spending package for now, marking a win for tech companies pushing to stall and override dozens of AI safety laws across the country.】

item.title: 期权交易员应对股市对战争风险的微弱反应
item.description: 面对日益加剧的地缘政治威胁，股市近期表现平静，这让期权交易商面临一个难题：是卖出波动率，冒着中东冲突升级时被打懵的风险；还是买入波动率，在实际走势保持低迷时损失权利金。在美国袭击伊朗核基地之后，这种紧张局势将进一步加剧。【原文：The stock market’s recent calm in the face of rising geopolitical threats had left options traders with a conundrum: sell volatility and risk being blindsided should the Middle East conflict escalate; or buy it and bleed away premiums as actual moves stay subdued. That tension is set to ratchet even higher after the US attacked Iranian nuclear sites.】

item.title: 全球投资者将涌向安全地带，等待伊朗的回应
item.description: 交易员们预测，在美国袭击伊朗三大核基地后，投资者为安全起见，股市将下跌，原油价格将跳涨，美元可能会走强。【原文：Traders are forecasting a drop in stocks, a jump in crude prices and possibly a strengthening of the dollar as investors head for safety in the wake of the US attack on Iran’s three main nuclear sites.】

item.title: 被逼入绝境的伊朗如何对全球石油贸易造成破坏
item.description: 美国对伊朗核设施的空袭使人们更加关注伊朗在冲突中尚未真正部署的一个选择：破坏地区石油贸易，特别是通过至关重要的霍尔木兹海峡的石油贸易。【原文：US airstrikes on Iranian nuclear facilities are sharpening the focus on one option Iran has yet to really deploy in the conflict: disrupting regional oil trade, especially through the critical Strait of Hormuz.】

item.title: 亚洲各国央行开始警惕货币干预
item.description: 一些新兴亚洲最大的中央银行似乎正在减少对货币市场的干预。【原文：Some of emerging Asia’s biggest central banks look to be dialing back their interventions in the currency market.】

item.title: 北约提出调整 5%的开支目标以赢得西班牙批准
item.description: 在军事联盟领导人于周二举行会议之前，北约提出对雄心勃勃的国防开支目标的关键措辞进行调整，以帮助赢得持反对意见的西班牙的支持。【原文：NATO has offered to tweak key language on ambitious defense spending targets to help win support from holdout Spain, before leaders of the military alliance gather on Tuesday.】

item.title: 苹果公司要想在人工智能领域取得成功，就必须离开自己的 "舒适区"。
item.description: 苹果需要进行史上最大的收购，才能结束人工智能的失败。还有Meta 推出新款 Oakley 智能眼镜；荣耀准备推出新款超薄可折叠手机；苹果一年一度的返校交易正在进行中。【原文：Apple will need to make the biggest acquisition in its history to put an end to its artificial intelligence debacle. Also: Meta rolls out new Oakley smart glasses; Honor prepares a new ultrathin foldable phone; and Apple’s annual back-to-school deal gets underway.】

item.title: 中国谴责特朗普对伊朗的袭击，这是自美国发动袭击以来的首次评论
item.description: 中国批评了美国对伊朗核设施的打击，并再次表示愿意加入国际社会恢复中东和平的努力。【原文：China criticized the US strike on Iranian nuclear facilities and again said it’s willing to join international efforts to restore peace in the Middle East.】
